propChildren:
The content of the component.

If `' '` is provided, the component reserves one line height for displaying a future message.
propClasses: Override or extend the styles applied to the component.
propComponent:
The component used for the root node.
Either a string to use a HTML element or a component.
propDisabled: If `true`, the helper text should be displayed in a disabled state.
propError: If `true`, helper text should be displayed in an error state.
propFilled: If `true`, the helper text should use filled classes key.
propFocused: If `true`, the helper text should use focused classes key.
propMargin:
If `dense`, will adjust vertical spacing. This is normally obtained via context from
FormControl.
propRequired: If `true`, the helper text should use required classes key.
stylesRoot: Styles applied to the root element.
stylesError: Pseudo-class applied to the root element if `error={true}`.
stylesDisabled: Pseudo-class applied to the root element if `disabled={true}`.
stylesMarginDense: Styles applied to the root element if `margin="dense"`.
stylesContained: Styles applied to the root element if `variant="filled"` or `variant="outlined"`.
stylesFocused: Pseudo-class applied to the root element if `focused={true}`.
stylesFilled: Pseudo-class applied to the root element if `filled={true}`.
stylesRequired: Pseudo-class applied to the root element if `required={true}`.
